intro: Xanthium varians, commonly known as the variable cocklebur, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small cones. The plant produces spiky, spherical fruits covered in hooked bracts, which aid in seed dispersal by attaching to animals. Its leaves are typically lobed and have a rough texture, while its stems are hairy and often branched. Xanthium varians is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including fields and along roadsides.
